dialog.text: Welcome, Philippos. I am so glad you came to listen to my manuscript for Book XII of Elements. You will not be disappointed.
My father wanted me to come and learn from the "great" Euclid. I on the other hand wanted to a solider as in the days of Alexander.
Well, young, Phillippos, your name means elements. Perhaps you can glean something from this manuscript for your glory days.
Yeah it also means, horse, lover, horse lover. Meanings don't matter.
Shall we begin? The laws of nature are but the mathematical thoughts of God.
Can't we learn geometry an easier way?
There is no Royal Road to Geometry. Now pay attention. Proposition 1. Similar polygons inscribed....
Oh man. He can really drone on and on, and he is only just getting started. Why couldn't my father have let me be in army instead?!?
